arXiv:hep-ph/0510169v1 13 Oct 2005

60 October Revolution Pr. 7A, Moscow 117312, Russia
Abstract
We have calculated the parameter ξ(0) = f− (0)/f+ (0) of the decay K + →

π 0 μ+ νμ in the spectator approximation of the Standard Model. It was obtained that ξ(0) ≃ −0.02.

The semileptonic decays of kaons afford an interesting opportunity to study the
quark currents. The isotopic symmetry of the strong interactions is successfully used
for calculations of such processes. This appears to be an illustration of a definite
factorization of the strong and weak interactions at low energies. This circumstance
allows us to reveal mechanisms of the quark currents outside the framework of
phenomenological approach. The semileptonic decay K + → π 0 μ+ νμ (Kμ3 ), well
studied experimentally, offers an interesting opportunity for such study.
We consider the Kμ3 decay (Fig. 1)

Parameter ξ(0) is determined as the ratio of the two vector form factors

The value of ξ(0) can be obtained by three different methods: by measuring
the muon polarization, by studying the Dalitz plot of the Kμ3 decay, and also
from the Γ(Kμ3 )/Γ(Ke3 ) ratio [1]. The consistent experimental values of ξ ∼
−0.1 are obtained from λ+ , λ0 and λ+ - λ0 measurement [2] and from the ratio
Γ(Kμ3 )/Γ(Ke3 ) [3]. The results of these experiments demonstrate a recovery of the
SU(3) symmetry because ξ(0) → 0. But the mechanism of such recovery is not yet
well understood.

These objects s̄ and ū can be current quarks, but we assume that they are
constituent quarks. Such interpretation is proven due to the experimental test of a
number of relations between amplitudes and cross sections. These ratios are derived
in the framework of the impulse approximation of the additive quark model [5]. In a
simple approach [6], there is a prediction for the existence of a soft scalar interaction
of constituent quarks in a hadron, and the spin-spin interaction can be large. For
example, it results in a considerable difference of masses of π and ρ mesons. We
assume that constituent quarks are non-relativistic. Taking into account the shortdistance nature of the weak interaction, we can use an impulse approximation to
interacting quarks within the framework of the spectator model.

The accuracy of ξ in this approach is about 0.1 and determined by the uncertainty
of the constituent s-quark mass of the model [6]. From the expression (16), the
mechanism of the recovery of the unitary symmetry relative to the value ξ is seen.
The extraction of ξ(0) with small uncertainty is possible in the experiment E246 [9],
where the normal polarization of the muon in the Kμ3 decay is expected to be
measured with high statistics and small systematic errors. The further precise measurement of ξ in the Kμ3 decay will allow us to establish the mechanism of quark
currents of week interactions.
